net.sourceforge.waters.model.module

Interface GraphProxy

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Proxy
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GraphElement

    public interface GraphProxy
extends Proxy
    A graph representing a finite-state machine.
    Author:
    Robi Malik

    • Method Detail

      • isDeterministic

        boolean isDeterministic()
        Gets the determinism status of this graph. A graph can be marked as deterministic or nondeterministic. In a deterministic graph, there can be only one initial node, and nodes can have at most one outgoing edge for each event. Because of the possibility of instantiation, these conditions can only be checked by a compiler with full accuracy, but editors can also use this flag to perform some preliminary checks.
        Returns:
        true if the graph is to produce a deterministic finite-state machine, false otherwise.

      • getBlockedEvents

        LabelBlockProxy getBlockedEvents()
        Gets the list of blocked events of this graph. The blocked event list of an automaton defines a list of additional events which the automaton synchronises on, but which are not necessarily enabled in any of its states. This makes it possible to specify that certain events globally disabled in any system where an automaton is used.
        Returns:
        The label block of blocked events or null to indicate that there are no blocked events.

      • getNodes

        Set<NodeProxy> getNodes()
        Gets the set of nodes of this graph.

      • getEdges

        Collection<EdgeProxy> getEdges()
        Gets the collection of edges of this graph. Although duplicate edges are meaningless, implementations are not required to check for duplicates, so the collection returned by this method may or may not contain duplicate entries.
